result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J. Schwartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 16CF302,15CM391,15CF437 called together at 3:13pm [mo]
Defendant Jason J. Schwartz in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 16CF302, Initial Appearance occurs:  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with the alleged victim, JRS
(*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--no possession of drug parphernalia 
--no presence at or within 1000 feet of the residence of JRS or the school of JRS
--no discussion of the case with Danielle Schwartz

As to Cases 15CM391 and 15CF437, Plea and Sentencing occurs: 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 15CM391; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Case 15CF437
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--assessment is to occur within 90 days
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--contact with Danielle Schwartz as approved by DOC
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete Certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if directed by DOC
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--to pay statutory costs, to include domestic abuse surcharge
--submit DNA sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served:  1  days
recess: 3:46pm

NEXT:   AS to Case 16CF302: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/14/16 at 11:00am   (2) Status Conference on 9/26/16 at 3:00pm
from counselor regarding defendant's non-appearance at the 8/9/16 hearing

Cases 16CF302 and 15CM391 called together at 10:03am [mo]
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses to parties that the Court received a voicemail from someone claiming to be Jason Schwartz, last night, indicating that he is at Rogers Memorial, further the Court discloses that the Court's JA spoke with a women claiming to be Jason Schwatz's mother confirming he is at Rogers Memorial.

Atty. De La Rosa requests a 5 to 10 minutes recess to attempt to call, Ms. Schwartz/ Rogers Memorial.

recess: 10:05am--reconvene: 10:50am
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that he has confirmed that Mr. Schwartz is currently hospitalized.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that resolution has been reached in one of the cases; requests that dates on calendar remain and if Mr. Schwartz remains hospitalized the Court entertaining a request for adjournment.

The Court maintain scheduled dates, the Court reschedules the Initial Appearance for 16CF302 to the next hearing date for 15CM391.
The Court requires that Atty. De La Rosa submit to the Court documentation of hopistalization, shall the 8/23/16 date need to be adjourned.
recess: 10: 56am
Motion hearing on August 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on August 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 10:39am. 
Defendant Jason J. Schwartz in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa reports that the attorneys have pre-tried the case, however no resolution has been reached.
On agreement of counsel, the Court addresses the State's Motion for Joinder of Cases #15CF437 and #15CM391 which was filed on 4/20/16.
After hearing the bases for the Joinder Motion from counsel, the Court grants the Motion for Joinder and orders Joinder of the cases for purposes of further proceedings.  
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
Mr. Schwartz verifies that the North Greenfield Avenue address remains current. 
recess 10:45am.

Cases 15CF437 and 15CM391 called together at 8:45am [mo]
Defendant Jason J. Schwartz in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance in both cases.

  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Schwartz. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Atty. De La Rosa requests a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled in felony matter, misdemeanor to follow as status conference.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling 
The Clerk announces date.

Atty. De La Rosa moves for a modification of Mr. Schwartz's bond; basis given
--Arguments given by ADA Hall
--Further arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa
--The Court denies the Defense's motion for bond modification; gives basis

Bond remains as fixed

Case called at 11:31 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jason J. Schwartz in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
Court reserves all rights of Defendant including right of substitution

Court continues the $150 CASH bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No possession of firearms
-Any firearms in the home, must be turned over to the Sheriff
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Danielle Schwartz or children
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 11:38 am
